p: Our general and conceptual case analytical models provide expressions for ∆T given by Eqs. 3 and 5, respectively. These expressions would be expected to result in several relationships in regression analyses between variations across the AMIP5/CMIP5 ensemble in ∆T, ∆F A, ∆F R and ∆F assuming that λ F and λ C are consistent across the models. Since we cannot estimate ∆C O and ∆C R our general case model in Eq. 3 requires the additional assumption that ∆C O and ∆F A are approximately uncorrelated. We expect this assumption to be valid since ∆C O and ∆F A are biases in completely different stand-alone ocean and atmospheric model components, which are largely developed separately.
